titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Student Volunteer Union of Central and Southern Ohio was formed for the purpose of uniting groups of volunteers so they could provide mutual help and inspiration in their work. Some of the methods through which this was accomplished were conferences, councils for leaders, newsletters, and exchange visits between member groups. Colleges with volunteer groups represented in the Union included Oberlin, Wooster, Muskingum, Ohio State University, Ohio Wesleyan, Wittenberg, and Oxford College for Women. An earlier name of this organization was the Southern Ohio Student Volunteer Union.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of minutes of the Student Volunteer Union of Central and Southern Ohio, 1921-1940. The minutes document fall council meetings, spring conferences, and other meetings held by the group at various colleges in Ohio. The minutes include reports of addresses and discussion groups, information on activities of Christian student organizations, treasurer's reports of dues and expenses, and the election of officers and other routine business. The volume includes a printed copy of the organization's constitution and several conference programs.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
